content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent’s anniversary party?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, who’s the guy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers? (Sits up) Who said that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, he’s really great though. He has this incredible zest for life, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughty girl I am.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to mom and dad this year?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20 th ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’d really like to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it’s always really moving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I’m going to make them cry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you wonder why Ross is their favorite?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him, and pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, “God, your brother.” Know what they’ll say this year? “God, you”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying. (Points to himself) I’m an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue. (snaps fingers)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really you can do that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding me? Watch! (Makes funny faces trying to cry) Well I can’t do it with you guys watching me!

content.description: Chandler and Monica’s, they’re getting ready to leave for the party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh I’m working on my toast for the party, or as I like to call it. Sob fest 2002. Hey check this out. (Hands him a picture.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a dog.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a dead dog. That’s Chi-Chi; she died when I was in high school.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s your parents’ anniversary and you’re going to talk about their dead pet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The good stuff, huh?
(Ross, Joey, and Rachel enter)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You got a present for my parents. That’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah, in honor of their 35 th wedding anniversary, I had a star named after them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww that is so cool.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I got them a book on Karma Sutra for the elderly.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, do you guys have any extra ribbon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, sure. What do you need? We got lace, satin, sateen, raffia, gingham, felt, (Pause) and I think my testacles may be in here too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww! Chi-Chi! Oh, I loved this dog! Y’know Monica couldn’t get braces because Chi-Chi needed knee surgery.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were the 200-pound 11-year-old who rode her!
(Phoebe and Parker enter)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!
All: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everybody, this is Parker, Parker this is…

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: No, no, no wait! Don’t tell me. Let me guess. (Points as he says their names) Joey, Monica, Ross, Rachel and, I’m sorry Phoebe didn’t mention you. (Chandler makes a face) Chandler, I’m kidding all ready you’re my favorite!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ha!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Why don’t all of you tell me a little about your self?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, actually, I’m sorry we-we probably should get going.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Classic Ross. Rachel, Rachel, oh how you glow. May I? (Puts hand on her stomach)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I, uh, think you already are.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Rachel, you have life growing inside you. Is there anything in this world more miraculous than—Oh a picture of a dog! Whose is this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s my old dog. He passed away years ago.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Oh well, at least you were lucky to have him. Bow-wow old friend, bow-wow. So where’s the party?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s out on the island. It’s in Massapequa.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Maaaassapequa, sounds like a magical place. Tell me about Massapequa, is it steep in Native American history? {Transcriber’s Note: Interestingly Alec Baldwin was born in Massapequa.}

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, there is an Arby’s in the shape of a tee-pee.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I got my note cards. (To Chandler) Do you got the presents?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I’ve got the car keys.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: We’re driving!?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Aces!
(Everyone except Ross and Rachel leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, he seems like a nice guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah I like him a lot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ya wanna hang back and take our own cab?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, otherwise I’m not going.

content.description: The Anniversary Party, Ross and Rachel are arriving and see his parents.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Hi

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! (Kisses his mom.) Hey mom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys have any pearls of wisdom?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Why would you serve food on such a sharp stick? (Looking a toothpick)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a good question, dad. That’s a good question…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmmm….

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Congratulations you two!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you…we’re so excited

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: And also, congratulations on your wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha—What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Can we talk to you for just a y’know… It’s just a little thing. Well we think it’s absolutely marvelous that you’re having this baby out of wedlock, some of our friends are less open-minded. Which is why we’ve told them all that you’re married.

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Thanks for going along with this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad so what we have to pretend that we’re married?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Son, I had to shave my ears for tonight. You can do this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can you believe that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, if you’re going to do the ears, you might as well take a pass at the nosal area.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, us having to lie about being married.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I know I don’t either, but ya know what, it’s their party, and it’s just one night. And we don’t even have to lie; we just won’t say anything. If it comes up again, we’ll just…smile. We’ll nod along.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Rachel!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Aunt Lisa, Uncle Dan

content.speaker: Aunt Lisa
content.text: Congratulations on the baby, and on the wedding

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Hmmmm….

content.speaker: Uncle Dan
content.text: Here’s a little something to get you started. (Hands them a check)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Aunt Lisa
content.text: So, how’s married life treating you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Unbelievable!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We love marriage!

content.speaker: Aunt Lisa
content.text: Great!
(The rest of the gang arrives including Parker.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: What a beautiful place. What a great night! I have to tell you, being here with all of you in Event Room C…I feel so lucky. I think of all the good times that have happened here. The birthdays, the proms, the mitzvahs both bar and bat, but none of them will compare with tonight! My God, I don’t want to forget this moment! It’s like I want to take a mental picture of you all! Click! (He takes a mental picture of them all.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think the flash went off.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Dahaaa! (Punches Chandler in the arm and he makes a face of pain.) I’m going to find the men’s room, be right back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll go with you

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Somewhere there is someone with a tranquilizer gun and a huge butterfly net looking for that man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I have to go to the bathroom too, but I don’t want him complimenting my thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m so we weren’t in the car! Did he ever let up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This room! This night! That waiter! His shoes! I must take a mental picture! (He backs into someone.) Ooh sorry…(He looks behind him then notices its Phoebe then stops his impression.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Were you guys making fun of Parker?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That depends, how much did you hear?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, he a little enthusiastic, what’s wrong with that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s just that, it’s so much.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, so what I like him! Do I make fun of the people you’ve dated? Tag, Janice, Mona? No, because friends don’t do that. But, do you want my opinion? Do you want it? ‘Cause in my opinion, your collective dating record reads like the who’s who of human crap. (Walks off)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I feel terrible.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What was wrong with Mona?

content.description: The Anniversary Party, Ross and Rachel have just gotten another wedding present.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Open it! Open it! Open it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah baby!

content.speaker: Man
content.text: So we never got to hear about your wedding!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: We were surprise that we weren’t invited.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, it was just our parents and 1 or 2 friends. It was a small wedding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But it was beautiful. I mean it was small, but kind of spectacular.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Where did you have it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: On a cliff, in Barbados, at sunset, and Stevie Wonder sang Isn’t She Lovely as I walked down the aisle.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, Stevie’s an old family friend. (Hits Ross’s chest)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Oh my God. That sounds amazing. I would love to see pictures.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So would I. You wouldn’t think that Annie Liebawitz would forget to put film in the camera.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Would you excuse us for a second? (Pulls Rachel off to the side) Umm…. what are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? I’m not you. This may be the only wedding I ever have. I want it to be amazing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. Ooooh, ooh maybe I rode in on a Harley .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Ross, it has to be realistic.
(Cut to Phoebe and Parker)

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Are you okay? You seem kind of quiet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m fine. I’m great. I’m with you.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: And I’m with you! What a great time to be alive! Look at this plate-bouncy thing. (Bounces the plates) What an inspired solution to man’s plate dispensing problems.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hm huh, yeah.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Ah! Oysters! Let me feed you one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, that’s not necessary.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Please.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, actually I don’t eat…

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: I won’t quit until you try.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, fine! Fine! (Takes the oyster and pretends to eat it while dropping it on the floor) Mmm…hmmmmm….

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: What are they like? I’ve never had one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t you just try one?

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: No, they look too weird.
(Cut to Monica and Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just going over my toast. Those two will never know what hit ‘em. I can’t wait. They’re going to be crying so hard. They’re going to be fighting for breath.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know if you want to, I can just hold them down and you could (Punches the air).
(Cut to Rachel and Ross)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And my veil was lace, made by blind, Belgium nuns.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Blind?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, not at first, but it was very intricate work and they said even though they lost their sight, it was all worth it.

content.speaker: Aunt Lisa
content.text: I’ll bet you looked beautiful…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I don’t know about that, but some said that I looked like a floating angel.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: So, how did you propose?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. That’s a great story.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, um, actually, I-I took her to the planetarium. That’s-that’s where we had our first date. Um, she walked in and I had the room filled with lilies, her favorite flower…

content.speaker: Aunt Lisa
content.text: Oh that is so sweet!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shhh! I want to hear the rest!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then, Fred Astaire singing The Way You Look Tonight came on the sound system, and the lights came down. And I got down on one knee and written across the dome in the stars were the words “Will you marry me?”
(Various oohs and ahhs)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And the ring, was the size of my fist (makes a fist)!
(Cut to Phoebe and Joey)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah uh, Phoebe! Look umm, I want to apologize about before, okay? We were being jerks. Parker’s a nice guy and I’d like to get to know him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then you better do it now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because I’m going to kill him

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys were right. He’s just too excited about…everything. I mean I’m all for living life, but this is the Geller’s 35 th anniversary. Okay? Let’s call a spade a spade this party stinks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know I’m having the worst time. There was a 15-minute line for the buffet, and when I finally got up to the plates, I slipped on a giant booger!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you sure it wasn’t an oyster?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess it could’ve been, I didn’t really look at it. Y’know, I just wiped it on Chandler’s coat and got the hell out of there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s just such a great guy I’m so excited about him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey, you should be excited about him. There’s nothing wrong with him he’s a good guy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Ya know what I think; I think we were all just being too negative.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re right. You’re right, he’s just embracing life. We could all stand to be a little more like Parker. You know what? I am like him! I’m a sunny, positive person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Actually, you have a little bit of an edge.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s that now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh look it’s Parker!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Look! It’s the bunny hop!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh I love it!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: You do?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you kidding? People acting like animals to music. Come on!
(Cut to Monica, at the microphone)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay it’s time for the toast! Umm now-now, I know that Ross usually gives the toast, but this year I’m going to do it.
(Everyone sighs)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no it’s going to be great. Really! Mom, Dad, when I got married, one of the things that made me sure I could do it was the amazing example the two of you set for me. For that and so many other things I want to say thank you. I know I probably don’t say it enough, but I love you. (Pretends to cry hoping her parents will join her.) When I look around this room, I’m-I’m saddened by the thought of those who could not be here with us. Nana, my beloved grandmother who would so want to be here, but she can’t because she’s dead. As is our dog Chi-Chi. I mean look how cute she is. (Holds up the picture and pretends to cry again). Was. (To an old man by the stage.) Do me a favor and pass this to my parents. Remember she’s dead. Okay, her and Nana, gone. Wow! Hey does anybody remember when Debra Winger had to say goodbye to her children in Terms of Endearment ? (Chandler covers his ears) Didn’t see that? No movie fans?! You want to hear something sad? The other day I was watching 60 Minutes these orphans in Romania, who have been so neglected, they were incapable of love. (Waits for people to cry, but doesn’t get any tears.) You people are made of stone! Here’s to mom and dad! Whatever!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Thank you Monica that was uh, interesting. Wasn’t it interesting, Jack?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Why don’t I remember this dog?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ross, why don’t you give us your toast now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no, Mom, it’s just Monica this year.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You’re not going to say anything? On our 35 th wedding anniversary

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, of course, Um… Um, everybody? Um, I-I just wanted to say…on behalf of my new bride, Rachel (She turns around and smiles), and myself. Umm, that if…if in 35 years, we’re half as happy as you guys are, we’ll count ourselves the luckiest people in the world.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh Ross…

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I just wish Nana were alive to hear Ross’s toast.

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, Parker and her are entering.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: My God what a fantastically well lit hallway!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can I get you something to drink? Like a water and Valium?

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh thank God.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: It’s a haven. A third-floor paradise. A modern-day Eden in the midst…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? I know! I know! Uh huh? Listen why don’t we just um, sit and relax? You know just be with each other. Quietly!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: That sounds great. (Sits down) My God this is the most comfortable couch I’ve ever sat on in my entire life. (Bounces on couch)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s try something else, let’s play a game.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: I love games!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shocking! Let’s play the game of who can stay quiet the longest. (Giggles)

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Or… Jenga .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, let’s play this one first. And remember whoever talks first loses!
(They sit back)

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: I lose, now Jenga .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Is something wrong?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wrong? Really? You know the word wrong. Everything isn’t perfect? Everything isn’t magical? Everything isn’t a glow with the light of a million fairies? They were just brake lights, Parker!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Well, excuse me for putting a good spin on a traffic jam!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t have to put a good spin on everything.

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: I’m sorry that’s who I am. I’m a positive person.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! I am a positive person. You are like Santa Clause on Prozac, at Disneyland , getting laid!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: So what do you want me to do, you want me to be more negative, less happy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Much less happy!

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Fine! Well then to quote Ross, “I’d better be going.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So long! Don’t let the best door in the world hit you in the ass on your way out! (He exits and she slams the door behind him.)
(There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it.)

content.speaker: Parker
content.text: Isn’t this the most incredible fight you’ve ever had in your entire life?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh huh. (Closes door)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, they’re returning from the party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …and then, we could’ve gone from the ceremony to the reception with you in the sidecar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, it just wouldn’t have been feasible.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But having a dove place the ring on your finger would’ve been no problem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was really fun being married to you tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! And! And, it was the easiest 400 bucks I’ve ever made.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Ross, can I uh, can I ask you something?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That proposal, at the planetarium…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, I know it was stupid.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you kidding?! With the, with the lilies, and-and the song, and the stars! It was…really wonderful! Did you just make that up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, actually I thought about it when, when we were going out. It’s how I imagined I uh, I would ask you to marry me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that would’ve been very hard to say no too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a good thing I didn’t do it, because it sounds like it would’ve been a very expensive wedding. (Rachel laughs) Okay, good night

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Goodnight
(They go off to their bedrooms)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Even if the sidecar had a windscreen so your hair wouldn’t get messed up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I will think about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s all I’m askin’
Ending Credits

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay that’s it. I give up. At mom and dad’s 40 th anniversary, you’re the one giving the speech.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know I don’t understand why they didn’t cry. It was a beautiful speech.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, come on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, we did learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin. And what you said about Nana. Ohh, yeah she really would’ve wanted to be there. And you know what? I think she was.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?
